file_content.text: Well, don't get all shy on me now. The Huntmaster's waiting.
The hunter returns a hero! It sure is good to see you all in one piece!
Let's get on with business.
What's next?
You don't look too bad yourself.
Right back at you.
I'm gonna look a whole lot better standing by your side, sugar, that's for sure.
I'm sure there are bits missing here and there.
I took some hits.
We can check for those later, sugar.
I told you I'd win this thing.
Shouldn't doubt me.
You surely did, sugar, and I'll never doubt you again!
The Huntmaster's waiting for you in the main room. Go on in.
Oh, and hunter? Great job.
Well, lookie here! I got myself a hunter who's reached the last leg of the Great Hunt. Ain't I just a lucky gal?
You've made this all look so easy, how about something serious for your final mark?
You ready for this, sugar? You're hunting Jedi Master Kellian Jarro, the "Mandalorian Killer" himself.
A Jedi Master should help cement my reputation.
I approve.
This fella's no slouch, that's for sure.
The name doesn't ring a bell.
Who?
Shoot, am I dating myself? This guy was a serious player during the last Republic-Sith War.
Is that it? I've wasted at least ten Mandalorians just getting here.
Should I be impressed?
Hate to burst your bubble, hon, but you've got some catching up to do.
At the Battle of Coruscant, Jarro single-handedly gave over a hundred Mandalorian soldiers the "Big Push."
Word is he's on board the Republic cruiser Aurora, so that's where you're headed next. You gotta take out Jarro and the Aurora to finish this hunt.
The crew won't just let me board.
Details? Entry strategies?
Gettin' to your target's part of the challenge, sugar. We do got a plan for that little old battle cruiser, though.
Taking on a battle cruiser by myself, huh? Maybe I'll keep it as a memento.
Sounds suicidal, I like it.
Cute, sugar, but keeping her ain't an option.
I'm not risking my starship in some suicide assault on a battle cruiser.
No way! My ship's an heirloom.
I feel for you, sugar, but sometimes the job's gotta come first.
You expect me to board a Republic cruiser in that hunk of junk you had me steal?
In my ship? I don't think so.
Go ahead, steal somethin' bigger, but the Great Hunt ain't gonna wait for you.
Once you're aboard the Aurora, you'll need to blast her hyperdrive regulator in the engine room. That gizmo protects the ship from the powerful forces of hyperspace.
Then head to the bridge and set the ship to jump into hyperspace on a timer. When it does, boom! No more ship.
They seem to have worked out all the details.
Sounds solid.
Hope so. Personally, I wouldn't wanna try it myself.
Couldn't someone just abort the jump?
What if they stop the timer?
Not if you blast the bridge controls after you set the ship to jump.
Do I get credit for every man who goes down with the ship?
Bonuses for collateral damage?
Sorry, hon, this one's a package deal.
Now, that's all I oughta tell you... but I wrangled some, uh, confidential information.
One other hunter made it to the final round, and he's already headed to the Aurora. Care to guess who?
Tarro Blood! That slimy son of a... he's gotten away with Braden's murder way too long. He needs to pay.
This saves us the trouble of hunting Tarro down.
Two birds, one blaster bolt.
Exactly, now's your chance to get revenge and clinch this thing for good.
He's been lucky, I'll give him that.
He's still cheating.
Yeah, we've seen the kind of "luck" Tarro's made for himself.
We'll step on his neck, Mako. Then fire until our blasters run dry.
He's going to die.
I hope I'm there to see it.
Okay, Tarro Blood deserves a rather gruesome end. I get that. But are we really going to fight a Jedi Master?
I intend to be ready. You do the same.
Let's move.
Jedi are all talk.
I'm not scared.
No, I'm all talk. Jedi Masters are something else entirely.
Don't listen to him. I'm with you all the way.
You back out now, Gault, and I reintroduce you to my blaster.
You signed up for this.
Hey hey hey, easy buddy. I was just exploring our options... sheesh.
I'll transmit the Aurora's coordinates. Best of luck.
We should probably get back to Crysta now that we don't have to worry about Tarro's cronies messing up the final round.
Sedyn's cost us too much time already.
We need to get back on track.
I'm not gonna let Soongh's sacrifice be for nothing.
We can't lose after all this.
What are you my minder now?
Don't be a nag.
Somebody's got to keep a schedule around here.
Welcome to Nar Shaddaa, hunter--sleaziest place in the galaxy. Your target is the Eidolon, a professional assassin with a right scary reputation.
Branded himself as the assassin who could kill absolutely anybody. For the right price, of course. Spent several years proving it, too.
His background is a mystery, but he used to do a lot of work for the Hutt Cartel.
I'd suggest looking up Gele'ren, a Twi'lek who works for the Cartel. Word is he hates the Eidolon more than just about anybody.
Oh, and when you find your bounty hunter rival, give 'em my best before you blast 'em to pieces. Happy hunting!
Nar Shaddaa. Always knew I'd find my way back here. Just didn't picture it quite like this.
Let's just focus on the job.
We've got work here.
Sorry. Homecomings, you know?
What did you picture?
Explain.
I guess I thought I'd come back with Braden and Jory.
You're from Nar Shaddaa originally?
So this is home.
Yep, grew up on the streets. Those were some nasty times. Then, Braden took me away from all that.
A few things you should know: The Hutt Cartel pretty much runs this place, with the Exchange and various gangs trying to carve out their own piece.
Crysta mentioned Gele'ren might help us track down the Eidolon.
I remember that Twi'lek. Used to be a scummy slaver. Had a bad rep, a real ruthless creep.
How do I find him?
Where's he hang out?
Let's hope he decides to be cooperative.
We'll see if he's trouble.
You'll convince him--you have a way with people.
I can tell I'm going to like him already.
My sort of person.
Yup, you and Gele'ren should have plenty to talk about.
A lotta things might have changed while I was away. Let me track him down.
Shall we head to the Promenade and see what Gele'ren has to say?
He's still working for Clan Loshanii. His office is on the Promenade, in the private lounge area of Club Vertica.
